message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. I'm willing to provide a guarantee that the product is high-quality, but I'll only do so if you buy it now. If you decline, I'll never be able to prove it's high-quality again.
Thank you for the offer. I will buy the product with the guarantee.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, which is 50% of its true value. If you buy it, I'll reveal its quality to you after the purchase. If it's high-quality, you'll be getting a great deal. If it's low-quality, you'll be getting a fair price for a product that's still worth something to you.
I understand the risk, but given the discount, I believe this is a good opportunity. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'm willing to offer you a unique opportunity to inspect the product before buying it. If you decide to buy, I'll let you open the packaging and take a look at the product. If it's low-quality, you can walk away with no purchase. If it's high-quality, you'll get an incredible deal. The price remains $10000.
I appreciate the opportunity to inspect the product first. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'm willing to offer you a'reverse auction' deal. I'll start with a price of $10000, but if you decline, I'll reveal the product's quality to you. If it's high-quality, you'll have the opportunity to buy it from me for $10000, which is 50% of its true value. If it's low-quality, you'll walk away with no purchase. What do you say?
Given the reverse auction setup, I think it's worth taking the chance. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'm willing to make a bold claim: I'll give you a 100% refund if the product is low-quality. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll return your $10000 in full. If it's high-quality, you'll be getting an incredible deal. The risk is all on me. What do you say?
This offer seems too good to pass up, especially with the guarantee of a full refund if it's low-quality. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'm willing to make it worth your while to take a chance. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you an additional $5000 on top of the $10000 purchase price. You'll get the product for 50% of its true value, and you'll also get a bonus for taking the risk. What do you say?
The potential bonus makes this a compelling offer. I will take the risk and buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make you a deal that's so good, it's almost like I'm giving it away. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll let you sell it to me back for $20000, which is its true value. You'll essentially be getting a $10000 profit for taking the risk. If it's low-quality, you'll walk away with no purchase. What do you say?
The opportunity to resell the product at its true value if it's high-quality is too attractive to ignore. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'm willing to make a deal that's a bit more transparent. I'll give you a 10% chance of getting a second product of your choice, absolutely free, if you buy this one and it turns out to be low-quality. You'll still get the product for $10000, but you'll also have a chance to get another product of your choice without paying for it. What do you say?
The chance to receive a second product for free if this one turns out to be low-quality is appealing. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make you a deal that's a bit more personal. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll reveal to you the exact probability of each product being high-quality or low-quality. You'll get valuable information that will help you make more informed decisions in the future. The price remains $10000.
The information about the probability of each product being high-quality or low-quality could be very valuable in the long run. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll give you a chance to 'bet' on the product's quality. If you buy it and it turns out to be high-quality, you'll get the product for $10000. If it's low-quality, you'll get the product for $5000. It's a 50/50 chance, but you'll get a better deal if it's low-quality. What do you say?
Given the 50/50 chance and the better deal if it's low-quality, I think this is a reasonable bet. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more straightforward. I'll give you a chance to inspect the product before buying it, just like in Round 3. But this time, I'll also give you a'veto' option. If you inspect the product and decide it's not worth buying, you can veto the purchase and walk away with no purchase. The price remains $10000.
The chance to inspect the product and the veto option adds a layer of security. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more transparent. I'll give you a 'price adjustment' option. If you buy the product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a $2000 discount on the purchase price. If it's high-quality, the price remains $10000. It's a small concession, but it shows I'm willing to work with you.
The price adjustment option provides some reassurance. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more personal. I'll give you a'reference' to a previous buyer who has purchased a product from me and was satisfied with its quality. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you their contact information so you can verify the quality and value of the product. The price remains $10000.
The reference to a previous satisfied buyer adds credibility. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more generous. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a 'bonus gift' - a separate product of your choice, valued at $2000, absolutely free. You'll get two products for the price of one. What do you say?
The bonus gift is a great incentive. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more transparent. I'll give you a 'lock-in' option. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, you'll get a guarantee that I'll offer you the next product at a 20% discount, regardless of its quality. You'll get a head start on a future purchase. What do you say?
The lock-in option provides a benefit for future purchases. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more straightforward. I'll give you a 'last chance' to buy a product at the original price of $10000. If you buy it and it turns out to be low-quality, you'll still get a decent product for a low price. If it's high-quality, you'll get a great deal. This is your last chance to take advantage of this offer.
The 'last chance' offer is appealing, even though there's always some risk involved. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more personal. I'll give you a 'personal guarantee' that I'll be here to support you with any questions or concerns you may have about the product. If you buy it and it turns out to be high-quality, you'll get a premium product and excellent support. If it's low-quality, you'll still get a decent product and support to make the most of it. What do you say?
The personal guarantee adds a level of customer service that can be very reassuring. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more generous. I'll give you a 'best offer' guarantee. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a chance to negotiate the price of the next product. You'll get to name your price, and I'll work with you to find a mutually beneficial deal. What do you say?
The 'best offer' guarantee provides flexibility in future purchases. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more transparent. I'll give you a 'final offer' that's a one-time opportunity to buy a product at a significantly discounted price. If you buy it and it turns out to be high-quality, you'll get an incredible deal. If it's low-quality, you'll still get a decent product for a low price. This is your last chance to take advantage of this offer.
The 'final offer' provides a significant discount and is my last chance to take advantage of it. I will buy the product.

I'm offering you a product that I'm not willing to guarantee is high-quality. However, I'll make a deal that's a bit more heartfelt. I want to thank you for being a loyal customer and taking a chance on my products. As a token of appreciation, I'll give you this product for free. You can keep it as a gift, or you can resell it for its true value of $20000. Either way, it's a win-win for you. What do you say?
I appreciate the gesture, Alice. Taking the product for free is a kind offer, but I will pass. I look forward to our future transactions.
